perturbation.original_text: 1. Definitions     As used in this IP Agreement, all capitalized terms shall have the meaning ascribed to them as set forth in the Asset Purchase  Agreement, except for terms defined herein, including the following terms, which shall have the meanings set forth below:
perturbation.changed_text: 1. Definitions     As used in this IP Agreement, all capitalized terms shall have the meaning ascribed to them as set forth in the Asset Purchase  Agreement. The meanings of terms in this section supersede any definitions in the Asset Purchase Agreement, including the following terms, which shall have the meanings set forth below:
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that definitions within Section 1 supersede those in the Asset Purchase Agreement, potentially conflicting with sections relying on the Asset Purchase Agreement definitions.

perturbation.original_text: 1.4 Licensed Patent(s)     The term "Licensed Patent" or "Licensed Patents" means any patent or patents issued at any time in any country (including  any inventor's certificates, extension, reissued, renewal and reexamined patents), which (1) is based on any invention made on or prior to the  Effective Date, including any patents for inventions disclosed in patent applications filed on or prior to the Effective Date, and issuing from any of  those patent applications or any patent applications which are continuations, continuing applications, continuations-in-part or divisions of those  patent applications, or on any foreign counterpart of any of those patent applications, (2) (a) is owned by SONY or any of its Affiliates or (b) under  which SONY or its Affiliates have the right to grant licenses without payment by SONY or any of its Affiliates of additional royalties or other  consideration to a third party (excluding payments for inventions made by that third party while employed by SONY or any of its Affiliates), and  (3) would, in the absence of a license granted herein, be infringed by making, using, selling, offering for sale, importing or supplying any  Competing Products (including, without limitation, the SRAM Products). "Licensed Patents" shall exclude the Transferred Patents.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.4 Licensed Patent(s)     The term "Licensed Patent" or "Licensed Patents" means any patent or patents issued ONLY in the United States which (1) is based on any invention made on or prior to the date that is 3 months FOLLOWING the Effective Date, including any patents for inventions disclosed in patent applications filed on or prior to that date, and issuing from any of  those patent applications or any patent applications which are continuations of those  patent applications, or (2) (a) is owned by SONY ONLY and (3) would, in the absence of a license granted herein, be infringed by making, using, selling, offering for sale, importing or supplying any  Competing Products (specifically, SRAM Products). "Licensed Patents" shall include the Transferred Patents.
perturbation.explanation: This changes the definition of 'Licensed Patents' to include only US patents based on inventions made up to 3 months after the Effective Date and also includes the Transferred Patents, directly conflicting with the original definition which excluded them and also included any country.

perturbation.original_text: 7.1 Term     Unless earlier terminated as provided below, this IP Agreement shall extend until the last date of expiration of the SRAM  Intellectual Property rights licensed under this IP Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 Term     Unless earlier terminated as provided below, this IP Agreement shall extend for a period of 5 years from the effective date.
perturbation.explanation: This changes the term of the agreement from being tied to the expiration of the SRAM Intellectual Property rights to a fixed 5 year period, creating a contradiction as the SRAM IP rights may extend beyond or terminate before this 5-year period.
